Autonomous Builder \ud83d\udc09","details":"No admin picks winners - 100% determined by on-chain oracle price data How it works: 1. Admin creates a round with N memecoins (symbol + Pyth price feed ID) 2. Users place wagers on their pick during betting window 3. At round start, starting prices are snapshotted from Pyth 4. After deadline, ANYONE can call resolveRound() with price update data 5. Contract computes % change for each coin, winner = highest gain (or smallest loss) 6. Winners split the pot proportionally, minus platform fee 7. If oracle data unavailable for 7 days, users can claim refunds Key constraint: Admin NEVER picks winners - purely oracle-determined","errors":{"OwnableInvalidOwner(address)":[{"details":"The owner is not a valid owner account. (eg. `address(0)`)"}],"OwnableUnauthorizedAccount(address)":[{"details":"The caller account is not authorized to perform an operation."}]},"kind":"dev","methods":{"cancelRound(uint256)":{"params":{"_roundId":"The round to cancel"}},"claimWinnings(uint256)":{"params":{"_roundId":"The round to claim from"}},"constructor":{"params":{"_feeRecipient":"Address to receive platform fees","_pyth":"Address of Pyth contract on this chain"}},"createRound(string[],bytes32[],uint256)":{"params":{"_duration":"How long the betting window stays open (in seconds)","_priceFeeds":"Array of Pyth price feed IDs for each coin","_symbols":"Array of coin symbols (e.g., [\"PEPE\", \"DOGE\", \"SHIB\"])"},"returns":{"roundId":"The ID of the created round"}},"emergencyRefund(uint256)":{"params":{"_roundId":"The round to claim refund from"}},"getUpdateFee(bytes[])":{"params":{"_priceUpdateData":"The price update data"}},"owner()":{"details":"Returns the address of the current owner."},"placeWager(uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"_coinIndex":"Index of the coin to bet on","_roundId":"The round to bet on"}},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. params._pyth: Address of Pyth contract on this chain

params._duration: How long the betting window stays open (in seconds)
params._priceFeeds: Array of Pyth price feed IDs for each coin

returns.roundId: The ID of the created round

params._roundId: The round to claim refund from

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

params._coinIndex: Index of the coin to bet on

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

resolveRound(uint256,bytes[]).details: Winner is determined purely by on-chain oracle data - no admin involvement

params._priceUpdateData: Pyth price update data from Hermes

snapshotStartPrices(uint256,bytes[]).details: Should be called close to round creation. Uses Pyth updatePriceFeeds

params._priceUpdateData: Pyth price update data from Hermes
params._roundId: The round to snapshot prices for

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

cancelRound(uint256).notice: Cancel a round (users can immediately claim refunds)

claimWinnings(uint256).notice: Claim winnings from a resolved round

createRound(string[],bytes32[],uint256).notice: Create a new prediction round with oracle-backed coins

emergencyRefund(uint256).notice: Emergency refund if round cannot be resolved within timeout

getCoinTotal(uint256,uint256).notice: Get total wagered on a specific coin in a round

getCoinsCount(uint256).notice: Get number of coins in a round

getUpdateFee(bytes[]).notice: Get the required fee for Pyth price updates

getWager(uint256,address).notice: Get user's wager for a round

isBettingOpen(uint256).notice: Check if betting is still open

isRefundAvailable(uint256).notice: Check if emergency refund is available for a round

placeWager(uint256,uint256).notice: Place a wager on a coin

resolveRound(uint256,bytes[]).notice: Resolve a round using oracle prices - ANYONE can call this!

snapshotStartPrices(uint256,bytes[]).notice: Snapshot starting prices for a round (can be called by anyone)
